member.name: T:Amazon.SSOOIDC.AmazonSSOOIDCClient
member.summary:
Implementation for accessing SSOOIDC
AWS Single Sign-On (SSO) OpenID Connect (OIDC) is a web service that enables a client (such as AWS CLI or a native application) to register with AWS SSO. The service also enables the client to fetch the user’s access token upon successful authentication and authorization with AWS SSO. This service conforms with the OAuth 2.0 based implementation of the device authorization grant standard (https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc8628).
For general information about AWS SSO, see What is AWS Single Sign-On? in the AWS SSO User Guide.
This API reference guide describes the AWS SSO OIDC operations that you can call programatically and includes detailed information on data types and errors.
AWS provides SDKs that consist of libraries and sample code for various programming languages and platforms such as Java, Ruby, .Net, iOS, and Android. The SDKs provide a convenient way to create programmatic access to AWS SSO and other AWS services. For more information about the AWS SDKs, including how to download and install them, see Tools for Amazon Web Services.

member.name: M:Amazon.SSOOIDC.AmazonSSOOIDCClient.#ctor
member.summary:
Constructs AmazonSSOOIDCClient with the credentials loaded from the application's default configuration, and if unsuccessful from the Instance Profile service on an EC2 instance.
Example App.config with credentials set.
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8" ?> <configuration> <appSettings> <add key="AWSProfileName" value="AWS Default"/> </appSettings> </configuration>

member.name: T:Amazon.SSOOIDC.IAmazonSSOOIDC
member.summary:
Interface for accessing SSOOIDC
AWS Single Sign-On (SSO) OpenID Connect (OIDC) is a web service that enables a client (such as AWS CLI or a native application) to register with AWS SSO. The service also enables the client to fetch the user’s access token upon successful authentication and authorization with AWS SSO. This service conforms with the OAuth 2.0 based implementation of the device authorization grant standard (https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc8628).
For general information about AWS SSO, see What is AWS Single Sign-On? in the AWS SSO User Guide.
This API reference guide describes the AWS SSO OIDC operations that you can call programatically and includes detailed information on data types and errors.
AWS provides SDKs that consist of libraries and sample code for various programming languages and platforms such as Java, Ruby, .Net, iOS, and Android. The SDKs provide a convenient way to create programmatic access to AWS SSO and other AWS services. For more information about the AWS SDKs, including how to download and install them, see Tools for Amazon Web Services.

member.name: T:Amazon.SSOOIDC.Model.CreateTokenRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the CreateToken operation. Creates and returns an access token for the authorized client. The access token issued will be used to fetch short-term credentials for the assigned roles in the AWS account.

member.name: P:Amazon.SSOOIDC.Model.CreateTokenRequest.ClientId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ClientId.
The unique identifier string for each client. This value should come from the persisted result of the RegisterClient API.

member.name: P:Amazon.SSOOIDC.Model.CreateTokenRequest.ClientSecret
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ClientSecret.
A secret string generated for the client. This value should come from the persisted result of the RegisterClient API.

member.name: P:Amazon.SSOOIDC.Model.CreateTokenRequest.Code
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Code.
The authorization code received from the authorization service. This parameter is required to perform an authorization grant request to get access to a token.

member.name: P:Amazon.SSOOIDC.Model.CreateTokenRequest.DeviceCode
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DeviceCode.
Used only when calling this API for the device code grant type. This short-term code is used to identify this authentication attempt. This should come from an in-memory reference to the result of the StartDeviceAuthorization API.

member.name: P:Amazon.SSOOIDC.Model.CreateTokenRequest.GrantType
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property GrantType.
Supports grant types for authorization code, refresh token, and device code request.

member.name: P:Amazon.SSOOIDC.Model.CreateTokenRequest.RedirectUri
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property RedirectUri.
The location of the application that will receive the authorization code. Users authorize the service to send the request to this location.

member.name: P:Amazon.SSOOIDC.Model.CreateTokenRequest.RefreshToken
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property RefreshToken.
The token used to obtain an access token in the event that the access token is invalid or expired. This token is not issued by the service.

member.name: T:Amazon.SSOOIDC.Model.RegisterClientRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the RegisterClient operation. Registers a client with AWS SSO. This allows clients to initiate device authorization. The output should be persisted for reuse through many authentication requests.

member.name: P:Amazon.SSOOIDC.Model.RegisterClientRequest.ClientName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ClientName.
The friendly name of the client.

member.name: P:Amazon.SSOOIDC.Model.RegisterClientRequest.ClientType
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ClientType.
The type of client. The service supports only public as a client type. Anything other than public will be rejected by the service.

member.name: P:Amazon.SSOOIDC.Model.RegisterClientRequest.Scopes
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Scopes.
The list of scopes that are defined by the client. Upon authorization, this list is used to restrict permissions when granting an access token.

member.name: M:Amazon.SSOOIDC.Model.RegisterClientRequest.CreateSigner
member.summary: Get the signer to use for this request.

member.name: T:Amazon.SSOOIDC.Model.RegisterClientResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the RegisterClient operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.SSOOIDC.Model.RegisterClientResponse.AuthorizationEndpoint
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property AuthorizationEndpoint.
The endpoint where the client can request authorization.

member.name: P:Amazon.SSOOIDC.Model.RegisterClientResponse.ClientId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ClientId.
The unique identifier string for each client. This client uses this identifier to get authenticated by the service in subsequent calls.

member.name: P:Amazon.SSOOIDC.Model.RegisterClientResponse.ClientIdIssuedAt
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ClientIdIssuedAt.
Indicates the time at which the clientId and clientSecret were issued.

member.name: P:Amazon.SSOOIDC.Model.RegisterClientResponse.ClientSecret
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ClientSecret.
A secret string generated for the client. The client will use this string to get authenticated by the service in subsequent calls.

member.name: P:Amazon.SSOOIDC.Model.RegisterClientResponse.ClientSecretExpiresAt
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ClientSecretExpiresAt.
Indicates the time at which the clientId and clientSecret will become invalid.

member.name: P:Amazon.SSOOIDC.Model.RegisterClientResponse.TokenEndpoint
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property TokenEndpoint.
The endpoint where the client can get an access token.

member.name: T:Amazon.SSOOIDC.Model.StartDeviceAuthorizationRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the StartDeviceAuthorization operation. Initiates device authorization by requesting a pair of verification codes from the authorization service.

member.name: P:Amazon.SSOOIDC.Model.StartDeviceAuthorizationRequest.ClientId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ClientId.
The unique identifier string for the client that is registered with AWS SSO. This value should come from the persisted result of the RegisterClient API operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.SSOOIDC.Model.StartDeviceAuthorizationRequest.ClientSecret
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ClientSecret.
A secret string that is generated for the client. This value should come from the persisted result of the RegisterClient API operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.SSOOIDC.Model.StartDeviceAuthorizationRequest.StartUrl
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property StartUrl.
The URL for the AWS SSO user portal. For more information, see Using the User Portal in the AWS Single Sign-On User Guide.

member.name: M:Amazon.SSOOIDC.Model.StartDeviceAuthorizationRequest.CreateSigner
member.summary: Get the signer to use for this request.

member.name: T:Amazon.SSOOIDC.Model.StartDeviceAuthorizationResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the StartDeviceAuthorization operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.SSOOIDC.Model.StartDeviceAuthorizationResponse.DeviceCode
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DeviceCode.
The short-lived code that is used by the device when polling for a session token.

member.name: P:Amazon.SSOOIDC.Model.StartDeviceAuthorizationResponse.ExpiresIn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ExpiresIn.
Indicates the number of seconds in which the verification code will become invalid.

member.name: P:Amazon.SSOOIDC.Model.StartDeviceAuthorizationResponse.Interval
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Interval.
Indicates the number of seconds the client must wait between attempts when polling for a session.

member.name: P:Amazon.SSOOIDC.Model.StartDeviceAuthorizationResponse.UserCode
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property UserCode.
A one-time user verification code. This is needed to authorize an in-use device.

member.name: P:Amazon.SSOOIDC.Model.StartDeviceAuthorizationResponse.VerificationUri
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property VerificationUri.
The URI of the verification page that takes the userCode to authorize the device.

member.name: P:Amazon.SSOOIDC.Model.StartDeviceAuthorizationResponse.VerificationUriComplete
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property VerificationUriComplete.
An alternate URL that the client can use to automatically launch a browser. This process skips the manual step in which the user visits the verification page and enters their code.
